intro: Hieracium megatrichum, commonly known as the giant hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers. The plant has a creeping rhizomatous growth habit, allowing it to spread aggressively in suitable habitats. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are hairy and often reddish in color. Hieracium megatrichum is often found in disturbed soils and can become invasive in certain regions.
